alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 8:22PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Tampico affecting Valley County. .The Milk River will slowly drop or remain steady over the next couple days. For the Milk River...including Tampico and Glasgow, Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Tampico. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, gravel roads north of the Milk River are impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 26.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM MDT Tuesday was 27.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to slowly fall to 26 feet Monday. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 1130 AM MDT.
